Ontology/Ontologies Supported: Fully customizable data collection screens; campus, college and department-defined ontologies
Uses elements of FOAF and Dublin Core in RDF; uses Pellet reasoning engine
Automatic Author Disambiguation: No (but can be done in conjunction with software developed at Northwestern University)

Research Networking Tool: Elsevier's Pure (now integrated with SciVal Experts)
Thesaurus/Controlled Vocabulary Used: "Elsevier Fingerprinting Engine" uses ten thesauri including MeSH to match and identify key concepts for an individual or group of people. Thesauri updates and expansion are ongoing.
"Elsevier Fingerprinting Engine" uses ten thesauri including MeSH to match and identify key concepts for an individual or group of people. Thesauri updates and expansion are ongoing.

Automatic Author Disambiguation: No (can be done manually by authors)
No (but can be done manually through Google Scholar "My Citations" functionality)
No (Though InCites can accept data from ResearcherID and Converis profiling systems for disambiguation)

Automatic Author Disambiguation: No (but can be done manually by authors)

Ontology/Ontologies Supported: VIVO RDF ontology with additional Profiles RDF classes and properties

Ontology/Ontologies Supported: The VIVO Ontology was developed and supported by NIH-funded efforts and continues to be developed and built upon through SourceForge and in collaboration with the eagle-i project.
